resources.string:
Baybayin The Philippines' ancient Baybayin script has a long history. Its genesis is said to have been in the thirteenth century, 
 and it was used by a number of indigenous cultures to write Tagalog and other Philippine languages. Baybayin, which uses 17 characters 
 to indicate syllables, was used for writing down information, keeping track of events, and expressing one's creativity. However, the introduction 
 of the Latin alphabet during the Spanish colonization in the 16th century caused the Baybayin to gradually disappear. The cultural value of the script 
 was attempted to be preserved despite its declining usage. As Filipinos rediscover and celebrate their language and cultural history, Baybayin is currently 
 seeing a renaissance. It acts as a marker of national identity and a reminder of the numerous customs that have molded Philippine culture throughout the course of history.

Ang mga patinig i at e at ang mga patinig na u at o ay may parehong karakter na may isang pangatnig, ang mga patinig ay kinakatawan ng palatuldikan simbol. Ang palatuldikan na simbolo ay nagsasabi sa isang mambabasa kung paano bigkasin ang mga salita.
Pasensya at mali ang iyong sagot :(
Bago isulat o isalin ang salita sa baybay kailangang kunin ang pantig nito. halimbawa:
At kung ingles ang isasalin sa baybayin kailangang isalin muna ito sa tagalog at tsaka kunin at pantig bago ito isalin sa baybayin.
